channel.title: Articles by Adam Sabin on Tech Terminologies
channel.description: Recent content in Articles by Adam Sabin on Tech Terminologies

item.title: What is VoIP (Voice Over Internet Protocol)?
item.description: Voice over IP, or VoIP for short, is a revolutionary technology that has transformed the way we communicate.

item.title: What is PPVPN (Provider-Provisioned VPN)?
item.description: A Provider-Provisioned VPN (PPVPN) is a type of virtual private network (VPN) that is provided and maintained by a service provider.

item.title: What is a VPN (Virtual Private Network)?
item.description: A virtual private network (VPN) is a technology that creates a secure, encrypted connection between a device and a network.

item.title: What is a Protocol-based VLAN (Virtual Local Area Network)?
item.description: A protocol-based virtual LAN (VLAN) is a type of VLAN that is created based on the protocol category of the network traffic.

item.title: What is an Orphan File?
item.description: An orphan file, also known as a “stray file,” is a type of computer file that has been separated from its associated data or metadata.

item.title: What is MFA (Multi-Factor Authentication)?
item.description: Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) is a security process that requires users to provide multiple pieces of evidence (or “factors”) to verify their identity before they can access a system or perform a task.

item.title: What is CEH (Certified Ethical Hacker)?
item.description: A Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH) is a professional who understands and knows how to find vulnerabilities and weaknesses in target systems and uses the same knowledge and tools as a malicious hacker, but instead using their skills and knowledge in a lawful and ethical manner to assess the security of target systems.

item.title: What is a Portable Application?
item.description: A portable application is a software program that is designed to be easily transferred from one computer to another and run on any compatible device without the need for installation or setup.

item.title: What is ZIF (Zero Insertion Force)?
item.description: Zero Insertion Force (ZIF) connectors are a type of electrical connector used in a variety of electronic devices.

item.title: What is XMP (Extensible Metadata Platform)?
item.description: XMP (Extensible Metadata Platform) is a standard for storing and organizing metadata (data about data) in a digital file.

item.title: What is PostScript?
item.description: PostScript is a programming language and page description language used mainly in the printing and desktop publishing industries.

item.title: What is DRM (Digital Rights Management)?
item.description: Digital rights management (DRM) is a technology used to protect digital content and prevent unauthorized access, copying, or distribution.

item.title: What is a GUI (Graphical User Interface)?
item.description: A GUI, or Graphical User Interface, is a type of interface that allows users to interact with electronic devices through visual elements such as icons and graphics, rather than typing commands in a command-line interface.

item.title: What is Garbage Collection?
item.description: Garbage collection is a fundamental concept in computer science, particularly in the field of programming languages.

item.title: What is an Application?
item.description: An application, or application program, is a software program designed to perform a specific task or set of tasks.

item.title: What is Grid Computing?
item.description: Grid computing is a distributed computing paradigm that involves the use of a large number of computers to solve complex problems or perform large-scale data processing tasks.

item.title: What is Cyberbullying?
item.description: Cyberbullying is the use of technology to harass, threaten, or intimidate someone, often repeatedly.

item.title: What is 3G?
item.description: 3G, or third generation, is a generation of wireless mobile telecommunications technology.

item.title: What is User Identification?
item.description: User identification is the process of identifying and authenticating a user’s identity in order to grant them access to a system or service.

item.title: What is a Home Page?
item.description: A home page is the main or front page of a website.

item.title: What is Golden Master?
item.description: A “golden master,” also known as a “golden image” or “golden copy,” is the final version of a software product that has been thoroughly tested and approved for release.

item.title: What is a Digital Signature?
item.description: A digital signature is a form of electronic signature that uses a combination of cryptography and authentication to provide a secure way of verifying the identity of the sender of an electronic document and the integrity of the document itself.

item.title: What is Access (Microsoft Access)?
item.description: Microsoft Access is a database management system (DBMS) that is part of the Microsoft Office suite of productivity software.

item.title: What is Bare Metal?
item.description: A bare metal system is a computer that does not include an operating system or any other software, so the user must install an operating system in order to use the hardware.
